      • onSendButtonPressed

        public void onSendButtonPressed(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String message)
                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Allow the sending of a message to a designated recipient. If the message is sent for the first time, a key exchange protocol will take place where the user sending the message will first send it's public key, then will wait for the other client to send it's key. if the key is not received in the next 10 seconds the key exchange protocol will end and show a fail message on the gui. In the case where the key exchange protocol did work, the Client encryption key will be stored in a "friends list" so that it can decrypt and encrypt all the following messages from and to the given client.
        Specified by:
        onSendButtonPressed in interface UserPageViewController.UserPageViewListener
        Parameters:
        username - username of the client we are sending the message to
        message - not encrypted message
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • receiveText

        public void receiveText(java.lang.String message)
        Receive the message and manage it depending on the header of the message. if no header is specified, then it is supposed to be a direct message from another client that has been encrypted.
        Parameters:
        message - Message received from the server

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread that receives all the message from the server and sends them to the receiveText() method.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
